sec.title: Introduction
sec.p: On the whole one models modules or specifies requirements in the form of “constraints”. These can be of a nature of rules (or guidelines), definition of concepts, a predefined set of permitted choices, (e.g., as coded domains).

This multipart ISO/IEC 29187 standard focuses on supporting privacy protection requirements in an ITLET context. Privacy protection requirements apply when an individual and an organization or public administration agree
At times, external constraints require, i.e., mandate, the participation of an individual learner in various learning transactions, (e.g., K-12 legislated requirements requiring an individual form age 5-6 to 17-18 to participate in a LET activity). to engage in a learning transaction.
The purpose of this Annex is to state these requirements. On the whole these are based on existing international ISO standards.
